page.title: 03Wildlife in the Valley.
page.content: There is an abundance of water from natural springs and the River Welland which occasionally floods small areas of land during the winter months. Coarse fish are present in the river and ponds which attract the Grey Heron, Kingfisher, duck and geese. Parts of the disused railway and quarry are uncultivated and provide a haven for wildflowers, grasses, rabbits, foxes and birds. The old pastures support hare and partridge- on the slopes of the hill a large badger set. Pheasants are reared in Holt Wood to supplement the wild population. The rookerys in the villages have been somewhat diminished due to the removal of elms with Dutch Elm disease. Wild blackberries,sloes and mushrooms are gathered in season but may soon disappear due to modern farming methods.
